name: Dragon Plant
climate: Prefers warm temperatures and high humidity environments.
Can tolerate average household temperatures very well.
Avoid sudden temperature drops and cold drafts.
Not frost-tolerant, should be kept indoors in cooler climates.
sunlight: Thrives in bright, indirect sunlight but can tolerate low light.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves and should be avoided.
If light is too low, growth may slow significantly.
Rotating the plant periodically ensures even growth on all sides.
watering: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
Avoid overwatering as this can lead to root rot.
Reduce watering frequency in the winter months.
Misting helps increase humidity, which the plant appreciates.
soil: Prefers well-draining potting soil with organic matter.
A mix with peat, pine bark, and vermiculite works well.
Ensure the pot has drainage holes to prevent waterlogging.
Re-pot every couple of years to refresh nutrients in the soil.
toxic: Yes, Dragon Plants are toxic to pets if ingested.
Can cause vomiting, drooling, and loss of appetite in pets.
extra_care_tip: Wiping leaves with a damp cloth helps remove dust and pests.
Consider using filtered water or rainwater to avoid fluoride burn.
Regularly check for signs of overwatering, like yellowing leaves.
